alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:15AM MST until December 29 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet with greatest accumulation through early this morning. Snow accumulation will range from 3 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Buffalo Pass, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard, Williams and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are near or just above 7000 feet currently and will drop towards 6500 feet by this evening. Additional snow forecast from 3 AM Today to 5 AM Thursday: Buffalo Pass 13 to 19 inches Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Forest Lakes 5 to 9 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Williams 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
